name: Dhis2-hii
body:
### The project: This project has the objective to offer a simple and intuitive way of reporting the state of health infrastructutes of a region, managing the information of the infrastructural state of the buildings and its inventory with periodical reports. This application will run on the information system [https://www.dhis2.org](https://www.dhis2.org) and our main goal is to provide a complete integration with an existing DHIS2 infrastructure, and making a solution where the user doesn't have to configure anything to make it work. This project is currently on development and a first v1.0 version is scheduled for the end of DecembeJanuary 2015. ### Demo: We have set up a proof of concept demo here where you can check the Dhis2-hii app. [https://dps-inhambane.asfes.org](https://dps-inhambane.asfes.org)

Log in with: hii.user / DemoUser2015 ### Download: DHIS2-hii is open source software licensed under the liberal BSD license and is free for everyone to install and use. The DHIS2-hii code is provided "as is". You can download the dhis2-hii repository as a .zip, and install it on DHIS2. ### Developers and collaborators: This application is being Coordinated by the ONG [Arquitectos Sin Fronteras](http://asfes.org), and developed by the [Facultat d'Informàtica de Barcelona](http://www.fib.upc.edu/en.html) and [Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya](http://www.upc.edu/?set_language=en), with the funding of [Agència Catalana de Cooperació al Desenvolupament] (http://cooperaciocatalana.gencat.cat/ca/) of the [Government of Catalonia] (http://web.gencat.cat/en/generalitat/index.html) and [Centre de Coperació per al Desenvolupament - UPC](http://www.upc.edu/ccd/), with the fully and grateful colaboration of the [Healh Ministry of the Republic of Mozambique](http://www.misau.gov.mz/) and the Direcçao Provincial de Saúd de Inhambane. ![Logos](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Samitier/images/master/logos2.png) ### Contact: Gorka Solana (Project Manager) @gorsol Blai Samitier (developer) @Samitier
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
